<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Your word of the day: “bombogenesis.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Definition:</strong></span><span> Bombogenesis describes when a storm undergoes a sudden and significant drop in atmospheric pressure, transforming it into a…bomb cyclone.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Use it in a sentence: </strong></span><span>Later this week, a storm is expected to undergo bombogenesis and slam the Northeast on Saturday with snow measuring in feet.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To all the entrepreneurial kids who run a snow-shoveling service for your neighborhood: Now’s the time to set up your QuickBooks.</p>

<span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>Stocks were chilling solidly in the green until Fed Chair Jerome Powell tapped the mic and explained that the Fed was planning to start hiking interest rates in March to combat soaring inflation. Then, they </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/25/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tanked</a></span><span> and Treasury yields rose sharply higher. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/26/the-federal-reserve-prepares-to-hike-interest-rates-in-march?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Fed prepares for March Madness
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/26/the-federal-reserve-prepares-to-hike-interest-rates-in-march?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Jerome Powell " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0f67efea88cf16752b811647bab07b808b404673-3000x2001.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Pool/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Come springtime, when we won’t have to worry about bombogenesis or cracked skin, the Federal Reserve is planning to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/federal-reserve-interest-rates-inflation-1dd9283e46162b3c0d29a2c55a2934d1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise interest rates</a>, the central bank announced yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">In the Fed’s words:</strong></span><span> “With inflation well above 2 percent and a strong labor market, the Committee expects it will soon be appropriate to raise the target range for the federal funds rate.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">This time in English:</strong></span><span> “We’re probably going to hike interest rates after our next meeting in March.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’ll go down in the history books. </strong>It would mark the first time the Fed has raised borrowing costs since 2018 and serve as a powerful symbol of the economy’s recovery from the depths of the Covid recession, when the Fed lowered interest rates to near zero.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, the Fed wasn’t <em>always </em>going to raise interest rates this March, but sky-high inflation changed the calculus. President Biden, Fed officials, and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/21/business/fast-food-prices-inflation.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuomT1JKd6J17Vw1cRCfTTMQmqxCdw_PIxftm3iWka3DMDmwbiO4IGImG9lzWIqRqfMd20TOcSJpZKr4kSec3z-lRO0VxSg6u5JuYnZBPawMElbWOZEJklZTcQeJ_tjbwcmiyLOo4nLPnsxvbOWb1XvPYgWkmcwlvvcBic1G13iYNxPzEFeFw24N0zu5hUs4hPUoIbSOLuvLtAhlsap7RPlyHtF5AC6wOUirTnNWc97sDbA5WbFnER3p96m8-g8hObJJVZO2sak59J7etxOkZGWdqL4y2BpYuRISylLxisLfFqBXk29MunuyNaXuQ3v2tl2kMbdqt&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chicago-based options traders</a> have all become increasingly concerned over rising prices, which forced the Fed to course-correct in December and plan for a series of rate hikes this year.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The view from Wall Street</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Worries over rising interest rates have pulverized the stock market this year—and tech stocks in particular, which become less attractive when bond yields go higher (as they have been).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The S&P is down 9.31% YTD, putting it on track for its worst start to a year ever.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The tech-focused Nasdaq has slid into correction territory, down nearly 15% YTD.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>But… </em></strong>rising interest rates don’t always spell doom for the stock market. <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-23/u-s-stocks-historically-deliver-strong-gains-in-fed-hike-cycles?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quite the opposite</a>, in fact. The S&P 500 has delivered positive returns in 11 of the 12 Fed rate hike cycles since the 1950s, according to Truist co-chief investment officer Keith Lerner.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why? Because the Fed tends to raise interest rates when the economy is growing, and a growing economy tends to be good news for corporate earnings.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead… </strong>the question now becomes, “How many times will the Fed hike rates this year?” Goldman Sachs is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/23/inflation-surge-could-push-the-fed-into-more-than-four-rate-hikes-this-year-goldman-sachs-says.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicting four</a>, but Powell didn’t rule out a hike at every one of the Fed’s seven remaining meetings this year to tame inflation levels that he’s said have gotten “just a bit worse.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more reading on the Fed: </strong>We <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/federal-reserve-with-christopher-leonard?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interviewed</a> Christopher Leonard, the author of <em>The Lords of Easy Money</em>, a new book that argues the central bank has been a driving force of inequality over the past few decades.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/supreme-court-justice-stephen-breyer-retire?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Supreme Court Justice Breyer today
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/supreme-court-justice-stephen-breyer-retire?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt='Spongebob getting out of chair meme with text "ight imma head out"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/67215888a77eea8359678e7325d46426e3bc4582-800x450.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Viacom</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer, 83, is reportedly planning to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/supreme-court/justice-stephen-breyer-retire-supreme-court-paving-way-biden-appointment-n1288042?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">step down</a> after 28 years of helping to make the country’s biggest decisions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Liberals promptly RSVP’d to the retirement party and said they’d bring cake. Many progressives urged Justice Breyer to step down so that President Biden (a Democrat) could fill his spot with someone who’s sympathetic to their causes. Right-leaning Supreme Court justices currently outnumber left-leaning ones by 6 to 3.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stephen who?</strong> Don’t feel <em>too</em> bad if you’ve never heard of him: Only 2% of likely voters in a C-SPAN poll from 2018 could identify Breyer as a Supreme Court justice. He was appointed in 1994 by former President Bill Clinton and typically voted along moderate-to-liberal lines. Breyer has supported a number of civil rights cases, wrote the 2015 dissent that opposed the death penalty, and never uses footnotes in his opinions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead… </strong>Biden has a big decision to make ahead of the court’s next busy term that will begin in October, which includes cases on affirmative action, abortion, and gun rights. Progressives are already reminding him of his campaign promise to appoint a Black woman. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who will Biden choose? </strong>Some potential names include Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson of the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, and California Supreme Court Justice Leondra Kruger.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/tesla-announced-record-profits-delayed-cybertrucks?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
This year, Tesla’s sticking to what it knows
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/tesla-announced-record-profits-delayed-cybertrucks?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Cybertruck with a loading bar" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-27/image-1e037d7df9558942e5f94f42248b3be6d45ecd59-1500x1000-gif/cybertruck-loading-0122.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Cybertruck with a loading bar" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-27/image-1e037d7df9558942e5f94f42248b3be6d45ecd59-1500x1000-gif/cybertruck-loading-0122.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In its earnings report yesterday, Tesla closed the books on a 2021 we can only describe as <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It posted a record quarterly profit </span><span><em>and</em></span><span> its first back-to-back profitable years since it was founded in 2003. Tesla’s $2.3 billion net profit last quarter jumped 760% from Q4 2020.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tesla also delivered a record number of vehicles last year despite ongoing supply chain bottlenecks—its “main limiting factor,” the company said.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what’s on tap for 2022?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">New factories: </strong>Factories in Austin, TX, started pumping out Model Ys late last year, while its Berlin, Germany, doppelganger is waiting on final permits before revving up. Analysts say the two factories could double the company’s overall production.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But no new car models: </strong>Production of the Cybertruck and Roadster has been <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/26/22903314/q4-2021-tesla-cybertruck-delayed-until-2023-elon-musk-earnings-call?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delayed</a> until “hopefully” 2023. In regards to the low-cost EV people have been hyped for, Musk said, “We are not currently working on the $25,000 car.” What’s up? “We have enough on our plate right now.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While Tesla isn’t introducing any new models this year, other automakers are picking up the slack. Thirty new EV models will be introduced to the US market this year, more than two times the amount that’s currently available.<em>—JW and NF</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you move your existing balance to <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/citi-simplicity-review/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-citisimp-01272022-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this credit card</a>, you’ll pay 0% interest on your transferred debt for 21 months. But that’s not all: You’ll also get a long intro 0% APR on card purchases.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means you can go into 2023 completely interest-free, whether you’re chipping away at your balance or using the card to pay for new stuff. Something else that might pique your interest? This bad boy has <strong style="color:#000">no annual fee or late fees</strong>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/26/key-performance-indicators-january-27?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/26/key-performance-indicators-january-27?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Neil Young performing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9d525829f2bf274ae722d3354df77d78c83d47ea-4778x3190.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Matthew Baker/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Spotify said it removed more than 20,000 podcast episodes related to Covid-19 since the start of the pandemic, but Neil Young isn’t satisfied. The music legend’s catalog is <a href="https://variety.com/2022/digital/news/neil-young-spotify-joe-rogan-1235164458/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officially being pulled</a> from the platform after Young wrote a letter telling Spotify that if it didn’t stop “spreading false information about vaccines” by providing a megaphone for the likes of Joe Rogan, he doesn’t want to be part of it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You’re progressive in one way and you’re still making that f***ing backward story about seven dwarfs living in a cave together…”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The actor Peter Dinklage, best known for his role as Tyrion Lannister in <em>Game of Thrones</em>, bashed Disney for its upcoming live-action remake of <em>Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs</em> on Marc Maron’s podcast. Disney <a href="https://variety.com/2022/film/news/disney-responds-peter-dinklage-snow-white-outrage-1235163195/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responded</a> that in order to “avoid reinforcing stereotypes from the original animated film,” it’s taking a “different approach” with those seven characters and has been consulting with the dwarfism community.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Watch: </strong>The resources you need to achieve your 2022 goals. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022-new-year-goals-tools-resources?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Chamath-SPAC-Akili-Interactive-prescription-video-game-public?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Don’t forget to play your prescription, honey
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s not a typo. Akili Interactive, the maker of prescription video games, announced plans to <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/26/22902537/prescription-video-game-adhd-spac-public-company?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a> by merging with a SPAC run by billionaire investor Chamath Palihapitiya. It values Akili at $1 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Akili’s video game, <em>EndeavorRx</em>, became the first video game to be approved as a medical treatment when it was greenlit by the FDA to treat ADHD in 2020. The game hasn’t been commercialized yet, but more than 1,000 doctors have already prescribed it. Next up, the company is working on tech to treat autism spectrum disorder, depression, multiple sclerosis, and other cognitive issues.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While the FDA hasn’t approved any other video game as a medical device, it has rubber-stamped two virtual reality-based therapeutics that treat conditions like lazy eye and chronic pain, according to The Verge.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Chamath brings some baggage to Akili’s SPAC party. On his podcast last week, he said that “<a href="https://www.ft.com/content/2386c577-7cb6-438f-b708-2aa27c2fd253?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nobody cares</a>” about the Chinese government’s genocide of its Uyghur minority, an issue that’s top-of-mind for many with the Beijing Olympics starting next Friday. His Twitter announcement of the Akili deal is <a href="https://twitter.com/chamath/status/1486324467940814851?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flooded</a> with comments saying the news is “below my line”—a quote from the pod.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s time to get swole. </strong>Or lean. Or running-your-first-marathon ready. Future pairs you with your own coach who creates a fitness plan to help you hit your unique goal wherever you are, whenever you want. <a href="https://www.future.co/?code=morningbrew&utm_source=affiliate&utm_medium=impact&utm_term=content" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Connect one-on-one with your coach today</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Want to level-up your daily life? </strong>Check out <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sidekick/subscribe?utm_campaign=sk_in_daily_012522&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=crosspromo&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sidekick</a>, our twice-weekly newsletter that curates recipes, productivity hacks, and content recs to help you live smarter. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Wordle variants: </strong>A bunch of Wordle clones have popped up, including the double Wordle <a href="https://zaratustra.itch.io/dordle?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dordle</a>, the difficult <a href="https://qntm.org/files/wordle/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Absurdle</a>, the NSFW <a href="https://www.lewdlegame.com/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lewdle</a>, the math-based <a href="https://converged.yt/primel/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Primel</a>, and <a href="https://leahneukirchen.github.io/luckle/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Luckle</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Meet really cool people: </strong>The world’s <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ao2Jfm35XeE" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">foremost expert</a> on snowflakes and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AIdGqyWTtD0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this guy</a> who never stopped being a kid.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The 411 on ESG investing: </strong>Erm, what’s ESG? Simply put, ESG investing = a belief in a better world. Listen to Amy Domini, industry pioneer and founder of Domini Impact Investments, explain why shared values matter, then <a href="https://go.domini.com/l/811213/2022-01-18/4j7xm?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">learn about the Domini Impact Equity Fund</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup>*This is sponsored advertising content</sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
The puzzle section
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew mini: </strong>You only have two days left to brush up on your crossword skills before taking on the big one on Saturday. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/26/brew-mini-candy?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play today’s mini</a> for practice.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Three headlines and a lie</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than someone who says they “love snow.” Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A veteran </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/25/1075558463/a-veteran-won-a-4-million-lottery-prize-using-the-numbers-from-a-fortune-cookie?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20220126&utm_term=6247952&utm_campaign=news&utm_id=46082882&orgid=305&utm_att1=" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won</a></span><span> a $4 million lottery prize using the numbers from a fortune cookie</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The secret to a good night’s sleep? </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/fWsgHNMfulJC1U8C8g/giphy.gif?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hot dog</a></span><span> lunches</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bradley Cooper, Benedict Cumberbatch, and the </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/bradley-cooper-benedict-cumberbatch-and-the-golden-age-of-nude-men-11643203801?mod=hp_featst_pos5" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">golden age</a></span><span> of nude men</span>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Fed prepares for March Madness \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/26/the-federal-reserve-prepares-to-hike-interest-rates-in-march?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Jerome Powell \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCome springtime, when we won’t have to worry about bombogenesis or cracked skin, the Federal Reserve is planning to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/federal-reserve-interest-rates-inflation-1dd9283e46162b3c0d29a2c55a2934d1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise interest rates\u003c/a\u003e, the central bank announced yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the Fed’s words:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “With inflation well above 2 percent and a strong labor market, the Committee expects it will soon be appropriate to raise the target range for the federal funds rate.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis time in English:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “We’re probably going to hike interest rates after our next meeting in March.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’ll go down in the history books. \u003c/strong\u003eIt would mark the first time the Fed has raised borrowing costs since 2018 and serve as a powerful symbol of the economy’s recovery from the depths of the Covid recession, when the Fed lowered interest rates to near zero.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, the Fed wasn’t \u003cem\u003ealways \u003c/em\u003egoing to raise interest rates this March, but sky-high inflation changed the calculus. President Biden, Fed officials, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/21/business/fast-food-prices-inflation.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuomT1JKd6J17Vw1cRCfTTMQmqxCdw_PIxftm3iWka3DMDmwbiO4IGImG9lzWIqRqfMd20TOcSJpZKr4kSec3z-lRO0VxSg6u5JuYnZBPawMElbWOZEJklZTcQeJ_tjbwcmiyLOo4nLPnsxvbOWb1XvPYgWkmcwlvvcBic1G13iYNxPzEFeFw24N0zu5hUs4hPUoIbSOLuvLtAhlsap7RPlyHtF5AC6wOUirTnNWc97sDbA5WbFnER3p96m8-g8hObJJVZO2sak59J7etxOkZGWdqL4y2BpYuRISylLxisLfFqBXk29MunuyNaXuQ3v2tl2kMbdqt\u0026smid=url-share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eChicago-based options traders\u003c/a\u003e have all become increasingly concerned over rising prices, which forced the Fed to course-correct in December and plan for a series of rate hikes this year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe view from Wall Street\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWorries over rising interest rates have pulverized the stock market this year—and tech stocks in particular, which become less attractive when bond yields go higher (as they have been).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe S\u0026P is down 9.31% YTD, putting it on track for its worst start to a year ever.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe tech-focused Nasdaq has slid into correction territory, down nearly 15% YTD.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBut… \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003erising interest rates don’t always spell doom for the stock market. \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-23/u-s-stocks-historically-deliver-strong-gains-in-fed-hike-cycles?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eQuite the opposite\u003c/a\u003e, in fact. The S\u0026P 500 has delivered positive returns in 11 of the 12 Fed rate hike cycles since the 1950s, according to Truist co-chief investment officer Keith Lerner.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhy? Because the Fed tends to raise interest rates when the economy is growing, and a growing economy tends to be good news for corporate earnings.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead… \u003c/strong\u003ethe question now becomes, “How many times will the Fed hike rates this year?” Goldman Sachs is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/23/inflation-surge-could-push-the-fed-into-more-than-four-rate-hikes-this-year-goldman-sachs-says.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicting four\u003c/a\u003e, but Powell didn’t rule out a hike at every one of the Fed’s seven remaining meetings this year to tame inflation levels that he’s said have gotten “just a bit worse.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For more reading on the Fed: \u003c/strong\u003eWe \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/federal-reserve-with-christopher-leonard?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterviewed\u003c/a\u003e Christopher Leonard, the author of \u003cem\u003eThe Lords of Easy Money\u003c/em\u003e, a new book that argues the central bank has been a driving force of inequality over the past few width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSupreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer, 83, is reportedly planning to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/supreme-court/justice-stephen-breyer-retire-supreme-court-paving-way-biden-appointment-n1288042?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estep down\u003c/a\u003e after 28 years of helping to make the country’s biggest decisions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLiberals promptly RSVP’d to the retirement party and said they’d bring cake. Many progressives urged Justice Breyer to step down so that President Biden (a Democrat) could fill his spot with someone who’s sympathetic to their causes. Right-leaning Supreme Court justices currently outnumber left-leaning ones by 6 to 3.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStephen who?\u003c/strong\u003e Don’t feel \u003cem\u003etoo\u003c/em\u003e bad if you’ve never heard of him: Only 2% of likely voters in a C-SPAN poll from 2018 could identify Breyer as a Supreme Court justice. He was appointed in 1994 by former President Bill Clinton and typically voted along moderate-to-liberal lines. Breyer has supported a number of civil rights cases, wrote the 2015 dissent that opposed the death penalty, and never uses footnotes in his opinions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead… \u003c/strong\u003eBiden has a big decision to make ahead of the court’s next busy term that will begin in October, which includes cases on affirmative action, abortion, and gun rights. Progressives are already reminding him of his campaign promise to appoint a Black woman. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho will Biden choose? \u003c/strong\u003eSome potential names include Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson of the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, and Tesla closed the books on a 2021 we can only describe as \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt posted a record quarterly profit \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its first back-to-back profitable years since it was founded in 2003. Tesla’s $2.3 billion net profit last quarter jumped 760% from Q4 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTesla also delivered a record number of vehicles last year despite ongoing supply chain bottlenecks—its “main limiting factor,” the company said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what’s on tap for 2022?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNew factories: \u003c/strong\u003eFactories in Austin, TX, started pumping out Model Ys late last year, while its Berlin, Germany, doppelganger is waiting on final permits before revving up. Analysts say the two factories could double the company’s overall production.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut no new car models: \u003c/strong\u003eProduction of the Cybertruck and Roadster has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/26/22903314/q4-2021-tesla-cybertruck-delayed-until-2023-elon-musk-earnings-call?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelayed\u003c/a\u003e until “hopefully” 2023. In regards to the low-cost EV people have been hyped for, Musk said, “We are not currently working on the $25,000 car.” What’s up? “We have enough on our plate right now.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile Tesla isn’t introducing any new models this year, other automakers are picking up the slack. Thirty new EV models will be introduced to the US market this year, more than two times the amount that’s currently available.\u003cem\u003e—JW and The music legend’s catalog is \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2022/digital/news/neil-young-spotify-joe-rogan-1235164458/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficially being pulled\u003c/a\u003e from the platform after Young wrote a letter telling Spotify that if it didn’t stop “spreading false information about vaccines” by providing a megaphone for the likes of Joe Rogan, he doesn’t want to be part of it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003e“You’re progressive in one way and you’re still making that f***ing backward story about seven dwarfs living in a cave together…”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe actor Peter Dinklage, best known for his role as Tyrion Lannister in \u003cem\u003eGame of Thrones\u003c/em\u003e, bashed Disney for its upcoming live-action remake of \u003cem\u003eSnow White and the Seven Dwarfs\u003c/em\u003e on Marc Maron’s podcast. Disney \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2022/film/news/disney-responds-peter-dinklage-snow-white-outrage-1235163195/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresponded\u003c/a\u003e that in order to “avoid reinforcing stereotypes from the original animated film,” it’s taking a “different approach” with those seven characters and has been consulting with the dwarfism community.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWatch: \u003c/strong\u003eThe resources you need to achieve your 2022 goals. color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDon’t forget to play your prescription, honey\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s not a typo. Akili Interactive, the maker of prescription video games, announced plans to \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/26/22902537/prescription-video-game-adhd-spac-public-company?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ego public\u003c/a\u003e by merging with a SPAC run by billionaire investor Chamath Palihapitiya. It values Akili at $1 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAkili’s video game, \u003cem\u003eEndeavorRx\u003c/em\u003e, became the first video game to be approved as a medical treatment when it was greenlit by the FDA to treat ADHD in 2020. The game hasn’t been commercialized yet, but more than 1,000 doctors have already prescribed it. Next up, the company is working on tech to treat autism spectrum disorder, depression, multiple sclerosis, and other cognitive issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile the FDA hasn’t approved any other video game as a medical device, it has rubber-stamped two virtual reality-based therapeutics that treat conditions like lazy eye and chronic pain, according to The Verge.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eChamath brings some baggage to Akili’s SPAC party. On his podcast last week, he said that “\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/2386c577-7cb6-438f-b708-2aa27c2fd253?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enobody cares\u003c/a\u003e” about the Chinese government’s genocide of its Uyghur minority, an issue that’s top-of-mind for many with the Beijing Olympics starting next Friday. His Twitter announcement of the Akili deal is \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/chamath/status/1486324467940814851?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflooded\u003c/a\u003e with comments saying the news is “below my line”—a quote from the pod.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
